channel.title: RSC Duplicate Client for RSCA
channel.description:
I've redone my RSCA client that was on my website previously. I basically copied the original Runescape HTML file and replaced some stuff to my liking and also and added a RSCA webclient.
Was fairly simple and quick. I posted one of my previous versions on RSCAngel and a few users claimed it was a .jpg file or some shit. If they would of examined the source they would've found that it is infact the RSCA client.
Here is a picture of the webclient with my logged in. old: http://i190.photobucket.com/albums/z217/cloroxen/other-1.jpg
new: [IMG]http://i190.photobucket.com/albums/z217/cloroxen/other2.jpg[/img]
Also, if you don't trust me, then download the client.jar file from here and decompile it and examine it and prove that I didn't change anything to the source. (http://mmoninjas.org/RSCA/92609/client.jar) As mapu stated in the RSCAngel thread I'm doing this to increase my site revenue and to help users out. If you have anything bad to say, then please don't. It isn't necessary.
Webclient available in my signature.

item.title: RSC Duplicate Client for RSCA
item.dc:creator: @nate_o nate o
item.description:
@nate_o wrote:

[quote=“The_AFKer, post:16, topic:302686”][quote author=nate o link=topic=398981.msg2962099#msg2962099 date=1253304598]

OH NO, PLZ NOT INJECTIONS!

Most of you mongoloids don’t realize how easy it is to phish. He doesn’t even need to run an application, simply clicking a link can get you infected quick.

Btw does anyone remember when xEnt toyed around with registries back in the day using modified clients? I MISS THE OLD DAYS!

Gtfo out of here. This isn’t for those purposes.

Why not? I think it’s time the mopars learn the malicious side of programming. Every one and their mothers can learn how to infect each other, and benefit!

Because, that has nothing to do with this thread.
If you’re too ignorant to realize that, then decompile it and see for yourself.

You’re a moron, I wasn’t referring directly at your webclient. Learn to read next time.

I meant keep it out of this thread. There is no need to even discuss that in this thread. So keep your mouth shut.
[/quote]

Too late, this thread had already failed both on RSCA and here. Although since you decided to keep talking and act even more retarded, let me point two things.

  1. Since when was advertising others on a third-party client considered development
  2. You listed your website in the OP, another rule broken.

Now, do the right thing, ask for a removal, shut YOUR mouth and quit acting like you know what you’re talking about. Nice job on the half-assed attempt to get money though. +1 to you.[/quote]

Your being a asshole for absolutely no reason. And since you brought up the whole breaking rule thing. Your breaking rule number 3. All I’ve done is ask you to keep your non-sense talk about malicious wares out of this thread. There is NO use for it here. Yet you continue to act like a complete asshole. There is no need for your opinion here.

Read full topic

Now, do the right thing, ask for a removal, shut YOUR mouth and quit acting like you know what you’re talking about. Nice job on the half-assed attempt to get money though. +1 to you.
